network-ref.description:
Contains the information necessary to reference a network --
for example, an underlay network.

Used to reference a network -- for example, an underlay
network.

node-ref.description: Contains the information necessary to reference a node.

Used to reference a node.
Nodes are identified relative to the network that
contains them.

networks_schema.description: Serves as a top-level container for a list of networks.

network.description:
Describes a network.
A network typically contains an inventory of nodes,
topological information (augmented through the
network-topology data model), and layering information.

network-types.description:
Serves as an augmentation target.
The network type is indicated through corresponding
presence containers augmented into this container.

supporting-network.description:
An underlay network, used to represent layered network
topologies.

node.description: The inventory of nodes of this network.

node-id.description:
Uniquely identifies a node within the containing
network.

supporting-node.description:
Represents another node that is in an underlay network
and that supports this node.  Used to represent layering
structure.

network-ref.description:
References the underlay network of which the
underlay node is a part.
